results.creator_credit: Hidehiko Takei, Satoshi Yamamoto and Tezuka Productions

results.title: Ron Barassi's top 31 players
results.brief_description: Football legend Ron Barassi selects his top 31 players from the past 31 years of Australian Rules Football. His selections (in random order) are: Michael Tuck, Leigh Matthews, Robert Flower, Gerard Healy, John Nicholls, Ted Whitten, Kevin Bartlett, Paul Roos, Doug Wade, Simon Madden, Peter Daicos, Malcolm Blight, Roger Hart, John Rantall, Keith Greig, Francis Bourke, Tony Lockett, Stephen Kernahan, Geoff Southby, Ian Stewart, Darrel Baldeck, Alex Jesaulenko, Bob Skilton, Gary Ablett, Greg Williams, Wayne Schimmelbusch, Kevin Murray, Barry Cable, Bruce Doull, Graham Farmer, Peter Hudson. Features fantastic footage of some of the legends of the game performing at the height of their careers.

results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Richard Brennan, Timothy White, Meridian Films and Smiley Films
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Joffe, Richard Brennan, Timothy White, Meridian Films and Smiley Films

results.title: A Ticket in tatts
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film stars George Wallace as a disaster-prone stablehand who owns a whistle that can make Cup favorite Hotspur run faster. A sub-plot of the film concerns a high society romance where a young girl has undertaken to marry an ageing suitor if his horse defeats Hotspur in the Cup. Much of the shooting for this film was taken away from the usual studio scene to location scenes at a stud farm near Melbourne, the Flemington racecourse and in the grounds of a palatial Melbourne villa.

results.title: Crafts of my province = Artisans de nouveau Brunswick [French language]
results.creator_credit: Marcel Martin, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary on Canadian artisans from New Brunswick revolving around a sculptress and her husband who is a potter. Shows how they decorate, glaze and fire the pottery and each year open their house as a showroom to lovers of art. We meet their friends who are silversmiths and get inspiration from the sea and rocks and use stones to make jewellery. Also shows wool being dyed and woven into cloth for sale to the USA and overseas.

results.title: Exile in Sarajevo
results.creator_credit: Alma Sahbaz, Tahir Cambis, Tom Zubrycki and Exile Productions
results.brief_description: A passionate and personal account of the siege of Sarajevo, from the viewpoint of Bosnian-Australian Tahir Cambis and Sarajevan, Alma Sahbaz. The directors encapsulate wider tragedies within two unfolding narratives. Nirvan, a talented young dancer, dies after a shelling attack. Her family, unable to come to terms with their loss, is forced to leave Sarajevo as refugees bound for America. Eight year old Amira’s illustrated diary is poignant testimony of the murder of family and friends. Both stories are set within the context of NATO bombing missions, UN Press Conferences and the liberation and reunification of parts of the city under Bosnian-Serb control. Cambis and Sahbaz the filmmakers become Cambis and Sahbaz the subjects. The grief of people around Cambis resonates with his own mother’s flight from Sarajevo in the 1950’s, forcing him to examine his own cultural inheritance. Anguished, enraged, even funny at times, ‘Exile in Sarajevo’ is an elegy for a city where Serbs, Bosnians and Croats still live in harmony, ignoring the myth of ethnic hatred. Edited by Bill Murphy, photographed by Roman Baska, Tahir Cambis and Alma Sahbaz.

results.title: The Mill on the floss
results.creator_credit: Graham Theakston, Brian Eastman, BBC and Carnival Films
results.brief_description: Driven by passion, intelligence and imagination, Maggie Tulliver ia a rare free spirit in the convention-bound world of Victorian rural society. Despite the fierce love between her and her stolid but resourceful brother Tom, who is incapable of understanding Maggie’s waywardly emotional nature, she turns to others for the companionship she craves. Denied the friendship of Philip Wakem, the son of her father’s implacable enemy, she meets and is drawn irresistibly to the young and handsome Stephen Guest. Torn between love and devotion to her family, she is rejected by Tom and only an act of supreme courage can effect a final but tragic reconciliation. Filmed in the beautiful rural heartlands of England, this outstanding new production is a vivid portrayal of George Eliot’s compelling story of love, rejection and reconciliation.

results.title: Southern Belle. Part 2
results.brief_description: This video is the second part of Greg Graingers journey into the Southern part of the United States. Visit states such as Tennessee, Louisiana, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi, South Carolina and Florida, take time to meet with a wealth of Southern characters and experience the life and customs of the south in a very upbeat and entertaining manner. Visit Dollywood (centre of the business empire of Dolly Parton) and Gracelands (home of the legendary Elvis Presley), paddlewheel down the Mississippi and travel to Nashville for a country music bonanza.
